headline: SoFi rolls out crypto trading, C3.ai reportedly exploring sale
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including SoFi Technologies (SOFI) rolling out a new crypto trading services for select retail customers, C3.ai (AI) reportedly exploring a potential sale according to Reuters, and Intel's (INTC) chief AI officer departing for OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Can Google’s Ironwood TPU Dethrone Nvidia’s AI Empire?
summary: The artificial intelligence (AI) boom has fueled explosive growth for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), with its graphics processing units commanding the lion’s share of the market for training and running large language models. This success has lured numerous companies into the fray, from startups to tech giants, all vying for a piece of the lucrative AI hardware ... Can Google’s Ironwood TPU Dethrone Nvidia’s AI Empire?

headline: Exostellar Launches AIM Platform – The Industry’s First Unified AI Infrastructure Management Solution for Heterogeneous Compute
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., November 11, 2025--Exostellar, a leader in AI infrastructure orchestration and optimization, today announced the general availability (GA) of its AIM (AI Infrastructure Management) platform — the industry’s first solution to deliver unified control of multi-cluster GPU environments spanning on-premises, cloud, bare metal, and GPU-as-a-Service deployments. headline: AMD expected to outline plans for AI chip business at analyst day
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices is expected on Tuesday to outline the company's plans for its ​artificial intelligence chip and systems businesses at a financial analyst day at the Nasdaq ‌in New York.  The chip designer has been attempting to expand its AI business as rival Nvidia gobbles up ‌market share for data center chips as the market explodes.  AMD has been successful in the central processor (CPU) business, steadily taking share against Intel.

headline: Micron Technology, Inc. (MU) Gains Analyst Confidence On Solid Positioning
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is among the most profitable semiconductor stocks to buy. On November 7, 2025, Aaron Rakers, an analyst at Wells Fargo, reiterated an ‘Overweight’ rating on Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU), while increasing the price target to $300 from $220, indicating an upside potential of around 26%. This update followed hosting meetings with […]
